definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: The glycemic index ranks foods based on how much they raise blood sugar.
sentences.chinese: 血糖指數衡量食物提升血糖的速度。

sentences.english: Cholera was recognized as an indicator of how well the environment is managed.
sentences.chinese: 霍亂被視爲可衡量環境治理成果的一項指標。

sentences.english: Measures the rate at which the company acquires new customers in a given time period.
sentences.chinese: 衡量在一定時間內從期初存貨中售出的產品比率。

sentences.english: Our measurements of latency are all two-hop timings.
sentences.chinese: 我們衡量延遲的標準是兩跳計時。

sentences.english: It is against the perfect humanness of Jesus that the dignity of every man is to be measured.
sentences.chinese: 這是對完美人性的耶穌的尊嚴，每個人都是來衡量。
你如何來定量衡量變化呢？

sentences.english: In either case you’re measuring and optimizing for second order effect.
sentences.chinese: 二者都是在衡量和優化優先級次高的效果。

sentences.english: The amount of coal and iron a country has proves a measure of its industry.
sentences.chinese: 一個國家的煤鐵產量可作爲衡量它工業的尺度。

sentences.english: I will decide requests for Incompletes on their merits.
sentences.chinese: 我會衡量整體表現來決定是否接受申請。

sentences.english: Obviously, such technical details are dwarfed by larger issues when it comes to determining mobile-market success.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，在衡量成敗方面，技術細節並非如此重要。

sentences.english: You can measure Kum value, but music is everybody's.
sentences.chinese: 你可以衡量琴的價值，但音樂是屬於大家的。

sentences.english: It can not be measured in terms of money.
sentences.chinese: 這是不能用金錢衡量的。

sentences.english: To measure loss and gain in this wise?
sentences.chinese: 用這種方法來衡量得失？

sentences.english: Ackermann's pay is unusually high by German standards.
sentences.chinese: 以德國的標準衡量，阿克曼的薪水奇高。

sentences.english: In America, temperature is measured on the Fahrenheit scale.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，溫度是用華氏刻度來衡量的。

sentences.english: We hold ourselves to high moral standards.
sentences.chinese: 我們以高道德標準來衡量自己。

definition: to consider/to give serious consideration to sth/consideration
whether or not (at the end of a phrase)
to consider/to weigh (a matter)/to balance (pros and cons)
touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
